review: My boyfriend and I come to this location all the time for lunch and dinner and have never had a problem. The wait is never too long, the waiters are always nice and attentive, and the food is always good and fresh. The only comment I have is that the tables and the menus are sometimes left sticky, and that always grosses me out. Also, some of the menu changes have eliminated some of my favorite items or changed them. Of course, I realize that has nothing to do with this particular restaurant. It's just a general comment. Other than that, it's a great location.

Big bummer! Me and 5 other colleagues stopped by this past Sunday.  We had about an hour or so to eat, only to be told there would be a 35 min wait.  In their defense the hostess cited the fact that they were understaffed.  Hmm,  not a big deal if the place was full but there were plenty of tables open with a rather empty parking lot to boot.  Hence the title "big bummer." As a result, we had to go somewhere else and certainly missed out on their prime rib tacos.  However,  the real loser of the day was Chilis as they lost out on about $170.00or so because the staff didn't want to hustle a little and take on a big party. Smh

Went into chili's today at 2:30pm to have lunch (maybe 3 tables not busy at all).  Sat our selfs in the bar area and the bartender got our drink order ( both ordered water). We then sat there for 20 mins waiting for someone to take our order. We had three worker walk by us multiply times and didn't ask if we needed anything or if we were ready to order. Well the manager was sitting at the bar talking to a friend we continued to sit there. Bartender then comes out with a drink order for another table as we sat there waiting for her to ask if we were ready to order she asks all the other tables if they need anything picks up a few plates and walks right by not saying anything. We then walked out with no one saying anything as the manger was still talking to her friend.

Not bad for a quick lunch with the coworkers, however our orders got  messed up and our bill was wrong twice! We all opted for the Lunch combo specials $6, $7, or $8. House Salad with Citrus Balsamic Vinaigrette - pretty good staple salad, however the dressing tasted like thousand island, and was very thick. I'm glad they put the dressing on the side, I just drizzled the salad very lightly with it since it was very strong. Half Margherita Flatbread - it wasn't cooked all the way through. They messed up my order because my coworker changed her Margherita to chipotle chicken and so the waitress changed both of our orders instead of hers. Out comes the flatbreads and they give me chicken, and I told them I didn't order this. The manager, I assumed, was serving us our entrees, so she took it back, talked to the waitress and confirmed that we had two chicken flatbreads...never the case, since I am vegetarian!  Everyone got their meal and I was waiting for mine, but it came too quickly in my opinion and I was right. The pizza wasn't cooked all the way. The center was uncooked and so I ate the edges mostly. I didn't have time to send it back, had to get back to work, and didn't want to be the only one eating after my coworkers finished their meal.  **Note: also DON'T play with their cool touch screen monitors at the table, it charges you 99 cents every time you do a trial game play or accidentally click on something you didn't know about. Just use the old fashion paper check and order your meal verbally!

Went to bar area Thursday night. Didn't catch the server's name but he's tall, handsome, clean beard with a high-pitched voice. We ordered the simple 2 for 22. took forever to bring out two Garden salads so you can imagine the entrees. There was a couple sitting behind us finishing up their meal they paid they left another couple came by shortly well they ordered and were served before us so that really struck a nerve. I called or the waiter and of course he didn't appreciate it and immediately came out with our cold meals. Poked the steak & sides and left. Ohhhhhh we also ordered an asparagus appetizer which we never saw and when I brought it to his attention he just said "sorry". Epic fail waste of time & money.

I've never hated on Chili's. It's generally a good crowd-pleaser, and with a happy hour! But I just have never been able to like the food very much. No matter how exciting your entree sounds, the food just tastes so generic and mass-produced.  My bf's son chose this place because they have little screens at every table where you can check out the menu and play video games. If a kid has choices and one choice involves video games, that's what they will choose. It's actually kind of genius for people who like distractions for their children, or rewards if they behave well in a restaurant. I ordered the Short Rib Enchiladas, he got the combination fajitas, and the lil one got the mac and cheese. We also got the fried pickles to share.  The short rib was probably the most bland I've ever had, and the mac and cheese looked/tasted just like Kraft blue box. Everything was good, but not GREAT. However, the bartender and servers were very, very nice, and we weren't rushed.  Chili's might be a good go-to for your grandparents, your kids, or a group that can't decide, but there are a lot of good food options if you want amazing food in this area.

Service was awful. There was a party of about 12 - 15 preteen girls with no adult supervision. We had a party of 15 and had to sit in different areas. It took forever for the waiters to take our drink orders. Having little ones I would not recommend going to this place. We went on a Wednesday evening I can only imagine a weekend. I or my family said never again. I don't care if the food is good or not, it's all about the service, and the service was AWFUL. Management was no where in sight to help with the servers. I guess they where to good for that. Very disappointed.
The salmon was delicious, the waitress was very attentive , will come again for sure!

We have been to this location in the past.. and enjoyed it.. tonight is an entire different story.  After a 20 minute wait which is understandable for a Saturday night.. we were seated and order right away.. after 40 minutes waiting on my food.. it's wrong.. and we had to ask for our salads which came out after the wrong food.. this has been the worst experience @ Chili's I've ever had!!

The customer service is horrible. Gave it a second chance and very disappointed again. Waitress was very unprofessional. She rolled her eyes and stormed off. I had to ask about the specials on a Monday night. Bar is small and very dirty. Stay away!

Wow this place has gone downhill. I gave two stars for the manager ONLY just because he was so understanding. My grandma and I went here last week, once we were seated we never saw our waitress. It as about 10 minutes (not busy and a weekday) and almost got up and left. Finally we flag down our waitress. She takes our drink order and we put in an appetizer. We tell her just a moment for the food order..big mistake. Another 10 minutes and no appetizer, no drink, nothing. We flag down the hostess and ask for our waitress. She comes back with drinks, no appetizers. I almost tell her never mind because by the time she brings it our food will be done. Keep in mind it is chips and salsa..not complicated. She apologies and immediately puts the order in and takes our entrees.  Much later we get our food which was mediocre. I got a burger and my grandma got steak. We NEVER saw her again, not even a check up on the food. We even had another waiter check on us.  He was even being sarcastic and rude to the couple next to us about their meal, I get it..sarcasm is funny but not about people's food.  Our waitress was kind and sweet NOTHING bad against her personally but it was awful service and we refused to tip. Now my grandma and I pretty much always do. But you know what servers feel entitled no matter how shitty their service may be. So now I feel you want a tip you gotta earn it. I called the manager right after and explained to him the situation. We aren't cheap, and we didn't leave a tip for any other reason other then the service. He understood completely and explained that is his policy. He said they understand they better have exceptional service for a tip. It wasn't about the appetizer it was the entire dinner service.  Hopefully service improves soon I love Chilis.

Their kitchen is horrible. This was the second time we came where two plates where fresh and the other three plates had sat under heat lamps until the center of the food was cold and the top of the food was dried and congealed. The manager treated us like we where a giant pain in her butt. The waitress was pleasant. We won't be back.

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!  Two horrible servers ! (And I use the term "server" very loosely.)  The first night we came in and had the misfortune of Kate as our server. She was rude and had attitude up the wall. Rolling her eyes and managed to make us feel like a burden our whole time there. At one point we ordered chips and guacamole and she came up with just a bowl of chips in one hand and nothing in her other hand, she sets the chips down and asks, "Was there anything else?" And we said we just wanted the guacamole and she responds with so much attitude saying, "I know I just haven't brought it out yet". Okay well how are we supposed to know that? It was a simple response to YOUR question and we get attitude for it? That was the last straw, I spoke to the host asking to speak with the manager and he asked why, I explained what happened and I said I didn't want to sit with her any longer, he said he would send the manager over and I said okay and sat back down. 10 minutes go by and the host keeps passing by seating tables and I finally stop him and he acts like I never asked him anything and asks me what I'm talking about and then he says, "Oh the manager is busy right now so if you want to move sections you can ask your server." I shouldn't have to ask our rude server if she will allow me to sit in someone else's section, so we stay at our table and continue to fake smile with her and then I see the manager passing by and I stop her and explain what happened and she says, "I am so sorry this happened, I had no idea this was going on because NOBODY TOLD ME ANYTHING." I noticed after that the host and her were talking to each other so I'm assuming they were friends which is why he didn't notify a manager. So the manager was very kind and apologized and offered us some coupons and said she hopes we give this location another chance. Now today we came back to try it out again and the first person we see is Kate and she makes eye contact and her face automatically drops and rolls her eyes. I don't know why we get the eye roll when it was YOUR fault sweetie, we didn't jump into your head and make you act so rude to us, you're mad because we notified the manager about YOUR wrong doing. So we talked to the host tonight and we were a party of three and we're quoted a 20-25 min wait. No problem, they were busy. After a couple minutes we noticed a table in the bar area leave so we decided to grab the empty table since it was self seating. We sat there for TEN MINUTES. NEVER GREETED ! But TWO tables sat five minutes after us (all Caucasian people) and he greeted them within a minute of sitting down. We were pissed. Not to mention, he made eye contact with me within two minutes of us sitting down. He also came to the table directly next to us and checked on them and still didn't come to our table. We then got up and asked the host to put us back on the waitlist because he was obviously avoiding us. Since our table was empty now, three more Caucasians sat at the table and guess who was there to greet them in less than a minute? The Caucasian server. I lost it. I asked the host to speak to the manager right away, as I was waiting I see BOTH KATE AND THE GUY WHO WAS SUPPOSED TO BE OUR SERVER peeking their heads out together from the bar area, when Kate's section was on the complete opposite side of the restaurant, so now we begin to put things together and it sure seems like we were being ignored because these two are friends or something else. The manager, Darrin walks up and I ask if we can speak outside and told him everything that happened. I was aggravated. Found out the servers name was CODY. No it's not certain that he put us off and never came to the table because we didn't look Caucasian, but I what I do know is that I observed him greeting Caucasian people only. Darrin was awesome and gave us his sincerest apologies and offered us coupons tonight as well. We greatly appreciated this and we thanked him and we ended up going to the Montclair location because we didn't want to see those servers again tonight. Honesty don't see why I would ever be back.

Came here after the movies and it was just OK. My husband and I got the 2 for $22 he got the cajan chicken pasta and I got a burger. My husband did NOT like the cajan pasta and but my burger was good. Didn't like the options for the appetizers so my husband just got 2 salads and ate both of them. This place is JUST OK. Its basic and lacks flavor for the most part. I would prefer Applebee's or Tj Fridays over this place.

Came in today around noon thirty and was having a really bad week. Lucky for me I was seated with the sweetest server ever!  I have a lot of allergies so yes I can be annoying but he answered all of my questions with a smile. I never once had to ask for a refill, becauee my glass was never empty (I drink water like a camel). I want to personally thank Robert for being a gentleman and putting a smile on my face in a week where I did not think that was possible. Not only did he get me to crack a smile but he had me laughing too. I will be back to thank you in person and to have another burrito as per your suggestion(it was fantastic). You are the Bees knees mister Robert sir. Thank you again again!

Terrible service and the hostess is obviously not well trained. Came in for dinner and waited for the hostess to come back to seat us. Another party of three walked in behind us and the hostess didn't even bother ask who was here first and seated the other party? My fiance told her politely that we are a party of two but she still seated the other party anyways. Will definitely not come to this location again.

Something has definitely changed at this location.  Went on a Thursday night.  Sat in the bar.  Service was good considering the poor guy seemed to be handling the bar area by himself.   Ordered Corona...they had run out earlier...seriously!  Then go to the local liquor store and stock up!  Chips and salsa...always my favorite and were great-probably the only thing I will come here for in the future.  Ordered the 2 for 20 options....what was that piece of meat?  Tasted and had the texture of liver-disgusting!  Both of us had a form of the "steak".... Ewwww....seriously gross.  Won't be back to a place I frequented twice a month.

So we just left Chilis in Glendora, I hate hate hate negative reviews!!!! So my hubby and I just left a funeral down the street, we wanted to get some dinner. We were seated right away. The waiter took his time to tend to us, a Caucasian couple walk in get seated right behind us, and yup you guessed right they get asked what they would like to drink. So we are still waiting and waiting and waiting!!! We both got really offended and walked out. Hubby called manager he was really really nice and apologized. My point is 2016 and people are Still being treated unequally. I am Mexican/American.

Food is always good, unless there happy hour is on in crackin then dont expect good service or hott food. If they r not over crowded the food tends to be warm and tasty. But if they r busy in the happy hour area thats all they seem to give attention to.

Came over here for dinner and booked a reservation on NoWait and said about 5 to 10 min wait and didn't see the point since got there and still waited. Service was good but getting the food sucked and took awhile to come and could see why as I saw others getting up looking for their server. Nothing to jump for joy about.

The food here is ok...but the service is horrible!!! There is never a host/hostess at the front so the poor bartender is constantly apologizing for the wait and trying to find someone to help. I've been here a few times and it's the same situation almost every time. I've come back because my daughter loves the sliders here but after todays wait, no more!

They are constantly messing up take out orders. I order from here many time a month and they're service has been declining in 2017. Certain items are being missed, including sides. Dining in is great but I almost always order take out. That experience is not so great.

This is my second time here in a week and I have to say the service is absolutely terrible. We've been sitting here now for 30 minutes, it's lunch time but slow and still have not gotten our soup. SOUP. I don't understand this place. We love chili's but this location is terrible. The food is good but not good enough to deal with such terrible service. Today and last time I visited, the Hosts (bot males) were very polite and I saw them doing more work than the actual servers did. 0/10 Will not come back.

The 1st was not that great because they were very busy. I don't recommend going there when it's crazy busy.  When there not that busy the service is fast food is great 2nd and 3rd time is getting better.  Thank you

We come to this location once in a while since it is close to home. Food was actually really good this time.  The server was nice, then..... we were still eating half my food still on my plate and she comes over tells us we can pay on the tablet,  "no rush". We said ok thank you as we were still eating. Few minutes later she started to grab plates from the table, i had to say wait and grabbed items off the plate. Next i noticed her grabbing my drink that was not done. Its frustrating when your told no rush yet they are grabbing off the table. And drinks are not cheap. I was so close to not leaving a tip and letting her know that she threw her tip away with my drink. But..im not one to cause a scene so i threw a few bucks on the table. WHERE IS THE CUSTOMER SERVICE. .

Nothing but bad experiences here. We've had bad service, poor food and long waits before. Don't know why we went back but now we know it'll never ever be again. The waiter wasn't the most friendly but I don't care as long as the service is good. Even though simple, the dinner salads were fantastic. Dinner took longer than would be expected for a 5:30 PM sit down. Hmmm. OK, no big deal but when it did come my wife's ribs were a disaster. Way over cooked and way over sauced and salty. Her broccoli side was cold and too salty as well. My penne pasta with chicken was OK, nothing to brag about but edible. My wife could not eat her dinner so we waited for our  server to return. Which he was supposed to anyway to bring more water. We waited, and waited. We finally were able to flag another waiter down and complained. He apologized and asked if there was something else my wife would like. She said maybe fajitas. To go because by now we were fed up and wanted to leave. The server brought her food to go but forgot the box for my leftover food. With suspicion now raised, my wife checked her to go order to make sure her order was fajitas only to find out it was actually slider burgers and fries. Total disappointment here. I had to get up and go find the manager to bring him to our table and complain. He did apologize and we did not pay for our meal but really? Don't waste your time with Chili's. It's not worth the effort. Go to Red Robin San Dimas and be treated as royalty with food that you can actually eat and be glad you did. Wow.

I got the new meat combo and I have to tell you I was sadly disappointed with the ribs. I got the half rack of ribs and jalapeño cheddar sausage that came with corn, garlic bread, and fries. The corn sides were fine and sausage was better than the ribs. But the ribs, I was surprised at how low quality the meat was. When I ripped apart the ribs where were purple spots all over the place and was hard to get off the bone. Never getting those ribs again. For appetizers we got the white cheddar queso and that was pretty good. They also removed hanger 24 and shock top. Overall not so pleased and may not come back for a while.
The food here is Horrible My Cheese burger came out all Soggy the Drinks didn't have any flavor as well the fries were Very Salty Definitely Not coming back to this Chilis

RIP chili's never will we ever give you our money again! We spent over 50 dollars in food but it was all bad. This was the last chance we gave this establishment. Because the previous times we were also very much disappointment. They got our order wrong. The food tasted bad. It was hard for us to pay for the meal because we knew it was not worth 50 dollars. Stay away. Go to Red Robin.  The only person we liked was Pamela she was a busy bee working.  She provided good customer service and she's a hard worker.

I can say that this particular chilis is by far the best! Clean, good, genuine service. I have never had an encounter with a server or bartender and it not be anything less than above expectation! The manager is always available and if anything is off in any way it's taken care of. The food is always great, drinks are amazing, and the bar tenders always offer great suggestions. When we bring our daughters with us it's equally great!  I heart this place! La Verne chilis great job on service and satisfaction!
My favorite restaurant. Great food, drinks and service. #bar#sports#drinks I always go for the fajitas, Santa Fe chicken salad, and smoked chicken quesadilla. The presidente margarita is the best.

Another golf team trip meal, very pleased. We always have at least 6 in our group so I never put much into how good the service is. But tonight it was exceptional.  They were moderately busy however the service was on point. Dustin was our server; he was attentive and made sure our drinks were always full.  We really like the bottomless chips and guac (we're usually starving after playing golf). Dustin made it a point to make sure the chips were flowing too. I ordered the chipotle chicken tex mex bowl. Originally Dustin misheard me and had me down for some chicken tenders (I was in the corner furthest from him, probably my fault). When the dish came out I voiced my concern and within 5 minutes a piping hot chicken bowl was in front of me.  Everyone else's food came out timely and hot. My teammates steak was cooked to his liking and everyone enjoyed their meals.  Not sure if/when I'll be back to this side of the country but I'm glad we stopped in at this Chili's and would do it again.
Great customer service .. and thank you to the manager (blonde lady) she was super nice after we decided we were changing our minds

Had a really good experience with the manager at this location the other day. 5 stars for him, 3 stars for the food.  The manager was very nice and accommodating with helping me with a problem I had with a take-out order. He was very nice and friendly.  The food however was not as great as him.  90% of the lettuce in my salad was brown.  Very disappointing.  Since it was a take-out order I couldn't really "send it back" so most of my meal was thrown away.  Otherwise the location and staff was great. Will give the food another chance.

It's our favorite Chili's!  Our family had been customers for over 10 years.   Not a complaint worth remembering.   Great food and good service; they made sure our drinks were always kept full.  Our little one loves Heather the hostess! We have been coming multiple times monthly for both lunch and dinner because of this lovely young lady!   Michelle is another sweet waitress that always took care of us.   We got Kai today,  she was very attentive to all the tables around us and so efficient!

This is one of my favorite stops in La Verne but something changed. Came in during lunch time and the service was slow. It was so slow that when our food was served, it was cold! It was tasty but cold.  I also ordered a salad and that was one of the oldest looking and tasting salad I've seen. Browning on the lettuce and the carrots tasted refrigerated and old. I ate what I could but this place needs to get back on its feet. There are times when I feel like Chili's is the right spot to head to. It's the casual vibe that's pulls it together nicely. I'll be giving it sometime before I head back.

This place is really only great if you have no other options around and I can pretty mcuh always find someting better than Chili's. That being said was invited here with family. I went for the quesadilla explosion salad, calling this a salad is insane as it is one of the items on the menu with the most calories, sodium and fat. The quesadillas were sad, limp and greasy, passed on eating them. The salad itself horrible quality, poor presentation. Service lacking, the long waits I don't get what for. Prices too high for the quality that you get, not worth it.

I never posts reviews for restaurants. I know how hard it is to run a business and important it is to have a good reputation for your own livelihood. This Chili's in La Verne is one of the worst places to eat. I've been living here for about 7 years and have maybe eaten here about a handful of times. Unfortunately, each time I do I am reminded why I don't go more often. Today was by far the worse. I get there with my son, the host takes my drink order right away. But, we don't get our drinks for about 10 minutes. Then right after another family gets seated and we are still waiting to give our orders. Finally the server shows up but goes to the table that came after and takes their order then takes ours. Ok, no biggie. We get our food and I made a terrible mistake in ordering the chipotle chicken and waffle dinner. It was terrible. It was overly drenched in sweet sauce. Then the server asks us if he can get us anything and we both ask for ranch for our fries and he comes back with only one for my son. He never refills or even offers to refill my drink. To be fair, they did not charge me for my dinner. But, I was very upset and disappointed with the service. I almost want to take it personal because it was so bad. The manager was right behind me chatting away to someone and never once came by to make things up or apologize for the crappy food. I will never waste my time or money there again. I suggest no one else does either.

I love Chillis, I really do. I take my girls there once a month when my husband is at work. It's our special lunch date. The last two times or so we have gone I have noticed dust everywhere. We always sit in the booths on the right of the restaurant and on the ledges it is very dusty. A quick swipe is all that is needed. I don't want dust in my food when the ac/heat kicks on.  Our food took forever today. NOT OUR SERVERS FAULT! She was triple sat. She worked very hard and did a great job. Please add more servers so that this doesn't happen again and PLEASE dust!

On 3/16/16, I took my son and daughter to Chili's after my son's baseball game.  After being seated we waited for approximately 10 minutes without anyone acknowledging our existence despite all the servers and employees walking by our table. As we continued to wait a younger couple came and sat down next to us. A waitress then came and took their beverage order!!! Once she was done, she turned and left without acknowledging that we had been waiting for service... I am a huge chili's fan and this is one of my children's favorite eateries, but the horrible customer service and the complete lack of consideration left a very sour taste in my mouth!!! I was so upset by the service that we left without ordering and went to eat at a competitors eating establishment!!

This is my second time coming to this location. First time I came the service was horrible. We came for lunch and it wasn't busy or packed at all. We placed our order and didn't come out an hour after. No one came to check up on us and it wasn't busy at all. Thought I would give it another try and it was my mistake to come again this time we went for dinner. The service was so bad our waiter did not check up on us at all we had to call him over. We placed our order around 7:40pm and did not receive it until 8:30. A table that was seated 20 mins after us got they're good before us. I'm very disappointed with this service and would not come back to this location again.

LAST TIME I VISIT THIS PLACE! Really bad service today I wished I filmed it. I walked in and there was people waiting and there was no host so we waited... And waited, no one acknowledge us so I stopped one of the girls. "Let me get the host" she said and she went to the kitchen (?) she came back and as she was passing by she said "15 to 20 mins" and that was it...

My family and I love this place. We only had one really bad experience here. But it has yet to happen again. Rebecca is a super good waitress we love her. The one time it was bad we didn't sit at her area and I think they were short of help in the kitchen. We gave the waitress a really good tip and paid for a drinks. But an hour later with our food done they said they'ed pay for it. We told them no that I didn't want it... But like I said that was one time it took me a few months of brooding to get over it. But we went back and sat in Rebecca's area and everything was great. :)

I visit this location once in a while and usually have no problem but today is terrible service. Was seated by a friendly hostess and had to wait 10 min to take drink order and another 10 to actually receive my water. I only ordered desert because I need to be at work in an hour and it's been half and hour and still nothing. Today's service is way to slow it's like the waiter forgot he had a section. Friendly waiter but bad service

Yes it's just a chain restaurant. But still. Food took more than half an hour from order to table, of five meals two had been under a heat lamp long enough for rice to crisp and sauce to skin over. Manager treated us like a problem when we complained, and when we sent one meal back as inedible taking it off the bill was treated as some sort of gift. Disappointing and crummy attitude.

I've been coming here for years and have always had a good experience, but new management has changed it for the worse. Recently went on a Thursday night at dinner time 6-7 pm. There were 10-12 people waiting and we were told it would be a 30-35 minute wait. No problem, except half of the restaurant was closed, when I asked why I was told they don't have enough servers to open that side. So said to the hostess "oh someone called out sick"? She said no we only open that side on Fridays and the weekend. 0_0 so I walked over to the closed side of the restaurant and there were two employees sitting at a table doing paper work of some kind (papers spread out over 2 tables). So I asked the two employees why this side is closed they also said "we don't have enough servers to open this section". So I asked are either of you servers one said yes so I asked the obvious question "why aren't you serving, are you on break" she said "no the manager has me doing this". So my family and I left as did another party of 10 and a party of 4 that had come in after us and also asked the same question about half of the restaurant being closed. The manager on duty was Dana, I don't know if she makes the schedule but I'm sure she has the power to call in a server or two, or maybe tell the server doing paper work to grab an apron and seat a few more guests. Never again chills, I'll drive to Applebee's in San dimas where the whole restaurant is open on a Thursday night at dinner time.
Had a great meal, decent marg, and good service at this location. No complaints whatsoever.

I keep giving these guys a chance because they are clos, but they always disappoint.  I walked in on a Monday about 740, the game was on, bar crowded, but the restaurant was half empty and no host to be found.  The floors were a mess, food and napkins everywhere, the few servers were frantic, and about 12 of us waiting in the entry for the host.  I waited 5 minutes before he showed and said it would be 10, waiting, waiting, meanwhile the restaurant is half empty!  Others came in and left, we did.the same because am sure service and food would have been below expectations.

Arrived at 8:30 to a store that was approximately 1/4 occupied. Was asked to wait 5 minutes. I asked hostess why the wait when the restaurant was empty and the reply was we have everyone wait. Ridiculous I don't wait  when it isn't busy. Store was filthy dirty floor and was not up to Chilies usual standards. Badly managed store.
Thanks Dustin for the awesome margarita!!!!  Go in when Dustin works!  He is the man!!!

Service is okay. Better than it used to be. My only real complaint is that there is no wifi! I couldn't get my internet to work at all even when I turned off the wifi! Definitely gonna start going somewhere where I can get signal on my phone!

I like this chilis, it's a good location, good people, the bartender is usually on top of things. It's pretty clean and the food us good. They are pretty fast here. There is always a lot of coupons in the email club or retailmenot so getting chilis at a cheap price is pretty easy.

Went to eat before trying to catch a movie next door.  I go out to eat alot, and know that we should have had plenty of time.  We got drinks fairly quickly, then sat there waiting for our order to be taken, and then sat there for awhile longer (over 1/2 an hour) and still no food.  Asked server to check on it, because we were trying to get to movie. Told us it was coming right out.  10 minutes later, I go to Hostess/Manager and ask that they just pack up our food to go.  Get back to table, and food comes.  Have to ask for boxes and take everything.  Just made it to the movie (walked across parking lot) as movie was starting.  Ridiculously long wait for soup, burger, and tacos.

Pretty good. That was the overwhelming review from the three of us who dined here on the night in question.  The food was pretty good, the service was pretty good, the atmosphere was pretty good and the local craft beer we sampled was pretty good. The deserts we tried were terrible but as someone who isn't big into deserts I don't really care about that. I had a brownie with ice cream, the ice cream was poor, the brownie well below the standards I expect and overall it was kinda "bleh". Parking is good and plentiful, the waitresses (we were actually served by at lease three which I found strange) were all very pleasant and helpful.  The food is not outstanding but you don't really expect it to be when you go to Chilli's, do you? It was pretty good and I have no complaints.... except about the desert which needs work as I mentioned already. Overall: Not bad, good prices, decent food, skip desert and tip your waitresses

We had been to this location before mutiple time we live around the corner. Service was bad nearly every time we went here. Always super slow.  we hadn't been there in well over 3 maybe even 5 months decided to go back tonight.  We get there order drinks and appetizers.  Guacamole was great.  We ordered our food I ordered soup and salad husband orders a salad kid orders chicken finger.  We wait forever for our food. It gets there, he drops off my salad and say sorry we're all out of the soup you ordered. So I didn't want either the other soup or chili so I ask to see a menu my husbands food is there so is my kids.  I'm stuck with a dinner salad in front of me that I would not have ordered if I was getting an entree. We got one refill the whole time we were there. I reordered waited forever to get my food everyone else was done eaiting. waiting on me to eat. I eat we're all done eating. Wait for the bill. Wait over ten mins not even kidding. No one comes by, we needed two boxes my husband got up to find the hotess no ones there he went to the other side of the restaurant and flags  down a waitress from another section she brought us boxes and the bill still never saw our waiter again.  The soup and salad I ordered would have been roughly $7.50.  The entree I got was $11.29 and they charged me for a dinner salad $2.99 that I didn't want. I ordered it when I ordered soup and salad. But if I ordered an entree from the start I would have never ordered a salad. The guy waited till all our food was brought to our table to tell me they were out of soup. He litterly set theside salad down and said im sorry were out ofsoup. he should have came over ten mins piror they whole time we were waiting and mentioned that. and not brought the dinner salad and said sorry were out of soup  would you like to order something else do you still want a side salad. nope not what he did.  clearly he had to enter in the computer to charge us. he should have noticed,  hey i wont charge them for a side salad since she didnt ge the soup and salad no.  They never once came by we paid on a dumb computer machine that they had on the table couldn't even question the $2.99 salad.  My $7.50 meal order turned I to $14.28.  Thanks a lot. I know for a fact I will never be back to this location again.
Usually not busy unless you go at night or on a weekend. The food is tasty, and the service is decent. Been to this location many, many times, and will most likely be back.
Best Chili's ever! Friendly and fast service... and great food :) Always a good time when I come here!

This is our local Chilis bar and grill. I ordered a Grey Goose martini straight up....the drink was very "watered down". I returned it immediately, informed the bartender and requested another. It was a bit better, but obviously diluted. Martini number three was much better. If watering down straight up alcohol is their practice, I can only imagine how diluted the mixed drinks must be....I'm not a fan of local establishments ripping off their loyal customers and will spend my hard-earned dollars elsewhere.

food was eh, service was meh. walked in with BF and his little brother, was promptly seated. we noticed that there were tablets at every table but the guy who seated us didn't explain what they were for. i assumed they were for ordering because we didn't have a waiter/waitress come to our table for 10-15 minutes. but looking through the tablet we noticed that we aren't able to order anything other than drink refills and desserts, so we just sat and waited for a while. after our waitress finally came she took our order. we ordered an appetizer, but it never came and it wasn't on the bill which probably means she forgot about it. we were all very hungry, and i was disappointed that our wings didn't come. our meals took a while to come out. after handing us our plates, our waitress didn't come to ask us how our food was or if we needed anything, and she didn't come at the end to give us the check. the tablet allows you to pay the bill with a credit card, but that wasn't explained to us so my BF just left a very small tip. in the end i had to go get a box for our leftover food because our waitress just didn't comeback. overall, it was such a sad experience and i don't recommend this place for outstanding service or food.
Nice clean restaurant,  friendly staff. Very slow on food arriving from kitchen. It is brunch time on sunday. Food taste and quality is good.

I keep giving this place a chance, but every time I come back the service gets worse. I don't understand how you get 2 servers to serve you and it's worse service than one person. The whole teamwork idea has not worked any time we have dined here. Right after we ordered tonight I noticed a delicious looking salad on an insert on the table. Our second waitress walked by and I asked if I could get that by itself, not with the whole meal pictured. She said if she could ring it in like that I could. 20 minutes later as our food arrived I asked her if she ever got an answer to my salad question. She said "your server told you no, you could only get it with the full meal" I told her "no one has told me that and I've been sitting and waiting for an answer so I could order a different salad if not" she walks away. I don't remember an apology or anything. First of all, when our hostess sat us we were told we had two servers. Server number 2 blaming server number 1 was beyond ridiculous. The way she worded her response really bothered me. Take pride in your job and own up and apologize if you forgot. Second, do what you can to make the customer happy. I'm sure I could have had that salad if you took the time to ask the manager. I am currently a server and have been for 12 years. I will jump through hoops to satisfy my guests. I guess I have to high of expectations when I go out to dinner.

Love this place,  steak is cooked to perfection.  Veggies fresh.  Great bartender, he made our drinks yummy. A lil far from my house but great for my after work unwind session lol. Wish all chili's where this good

The food was great, but i cant say the same about my service.  My friend and i got the two for twenty deal.  We didnt recirve our appetizer until after the food. Bwould have been nice to get it sooner, but it was still delicious.
Horrible service! Robert was lazy and not very personable. The manager just made excuses for him! Horrible!

Chili's, Laverne is okay. It's not the best location, but the food is still pretty good. This location closes really early and lacks that fun atmosphere locations like West Covina and especially Diamond Bar have. This is most likely due to the city it's in. However, it's still a decent place to go for 'American food' when in the area. As mentioned before, the food is the same as any other Chili's. Personally, it's hard to taste any difference between the food from this Chili's and many other locations. The food is good and the drinks are okay. Also, customers could substitute items in an order. So that's great. The workers are generally nice. I've never had an issue. The servers don't have as much spunk or energy as the servers at the Diamond Bar location, though. Of course, I'm generalizing here. I've been waited on by a perky waitress once and a very friendly and talkative waiter, JD or JT, various times. He's a lot like the majority of servers at the Diamond Bar location, which is my favorite location because of the friendliness and great atmosphere. Last week he even changed the channel on the t.v. at the bar so my girlfriend could watch the Dodgers game. That was pretty cool. Chili's, Laverne is definitely not the best location. But it's alright. The servers are okay, substitutions are welcomed, and the food is just like any other Chili's. The atmosphere is a bit bland and the place closes around 9PM, so don't expect more than to eat a good burger and go.

This is the first review I have ever written.  What a horrible experience.  Never did get to eat.  Waited an hour and the whole time  there were empty tables.  Gave up and left.  All time worst experience.
Yummy as usual.  I love coming here and it did not disappoint.  I will be back soon.

I went to Chili's alone in order to focus my observation of their service. The receptionist tenderly greeted with smile and led me to a small table with two seats near the kitchen. The noise level was a little high but within my tolerance zone. I checked the time, it was 12:05, there were only two table seated with consumers in my area, which has eight capacities in total.  The drink: Mango Ice Tea      The waitress reacted with a little shock due to my eccentric type of favor on drinks. Well, I really try to adapt some American life styles but I just love warm water when the weather is quite temperate. I did not want to be treated like a total alien so I changed my mind to order a drink when another waitress came to help me. I pointed the drink menu and asked her which one was sweeter, blackberry ice tea or mango ice tea. She told me that mango one was more popular and I told her I would try mango one. She left the table and came back quickly with two cups of drinks that only filled on the bottoms, both blackberry and mango, without ice as I requested. What a surprise! I tried both, they were pretty light, and I expected something stronger. I expressed my need and order mango ice tea. The waitress served me the tea with no ice but extra syrup. How nice she was! The mango ice tea only cost $2.79. The entrée: Mango-Chile Tilapia I ordered a Mango-Chile Tilapia as my main dish, which was priced at $10.49. It was a sautéed tilapia with steamed broccoli and fried rice. The tilapia was very fresh however with no gross sea odor that most people hate. It was delicately sautéed with garlic salt, parsley, black pepper, green chilies, and fresh lemon juice. After the cooking(sautéing) process, it was capped with fresh sliced avocados and tomato. The tilapia tasted a little salty, but basically fitted my flavor. It also tasted mildly sour, you would find out it was made from fresh lemon juice too. Furthermore, it tasted a little spicy- it probably would be very spicy for non-spicy eaters. I like this spicy flavor because it was well cooked and entirely mixed with other source. I gradually felt the hotness that evenly covered my mouth and then haunted for a while. The fresh avocadoes, tomato and steamed broccoli were the perfect match with the tilapia to me because I wanted my dish less salty, I only needed to dip them into the tilapia source. The fried rice was cooked with a few sweet corns, they did not add flavor but the fried rice looked more delicious.  The soup: Terligua Chile The tilapia was like an appetizer to me because lemon juice can make people want to eat more. I was basically full but I wanted to see how their soup tastes. I checked the menu and found out that Chili's did not have too many choices for soup. I ordered a Terligua Chile for $3.09, which was 50 cents less than regular price since I ordered an entrée dish. The Terlingua Chili soup was cooked with beef, beans and several kinds of scrunched vegies, on top were sliced cheese. The soup was creamy when I tasted it alone, then I blended the cheese and it became very sticky and more flavorful. The size of the soup was very tiny, however, I felt stuffed after I finished it. At that moment, the restaurant reached full house of capacity. It was 1:00 p.m. The Dessert: The Peanut Butter Skillet Cookie I would not eat this much if it was not for my curiosity. Even though it was not the first time I went to Chili's but I never really cared about the food in Chili's since it was not my type of food. After I finished my soup, the waitress came again to ask if I needed anything else. I told her I would order in ten minutes and I thereafter did order this big peanut butter skillet cookie with vanilla ice cream on top, the price was $5.89. The waitress served The Peanut Butter Skillet Cookie a few minutes after I ordered. The cookie looked very hot because it came with the skillet that just pulled out from the oven, with a handle cover, which prevents consumers from burning. The ice cream was dressed cameral which looked nice. I had a spoon of ice cream and it tasted like the breeze of summer, it was very mild but creamy. On the other hand, the cookie was very sweet but the peanut helped make it less greasy. ToGos: I asked to refill the ice tea and ended up not drinking at all due to a staffed stomach. I tried to ask if Chili's could provide a cup for my tea to go. As a result, the waitress served me with a bubble cup that contained half cup of ice tea because the bubble cup doubles the size of regular cup they use in the restaurant. I poured the tea thatI did not finish in the bubble cup, also I got a box for my cookie leftovers to go at 1:40 p.m.   One star cut due to no Wifi provided.

Set in the bar late one night at the bar booths. Service was very prompt and orders where given right away. Food came out really fast! Waiter was really nice the whole time and really on top of it, he constantly made sure we had what we needed.
The absolute worst hamburger I've ever tasted. Half a bottle ketchup couldn't add enough moisture to it to make it taste good.

This was the worst experience I've had at Chili's, and I will not be going back to this location. Our waiter kept saying she would bring us a certain item (napkins, drinks, etc) but never did until we asked for the 3rd time. Then, I noticed she was doing the same to the table in front of us, so much that they called the manager. I understand that was busy, so we let it slide. Then, our salads were very soggy and "from the bag." When our food came, they forgot my daughter's meal. So we waited. When it came for dessert, we ordered the cookie. 10, 15 minutes had gone by... No cookie. By that time, my 1 year old was restless and wanting to leave. We had 4 waiters come by and ask us what we needed, and we explained the cookie situation.. They all stated that they would bring it, yet none of them did! Finally we called the manager, who apologized and brought us our cookie to go, after my daughter had been extensively crying. Boy, when it came down to paying our bill, our waiter whipped it into shape, and was the fastest I'd seen her all night! Where was she before? Never again will we go here!

Service was incredible! Matt did a fantastic job, with great support from up from the other staff.  The truth is that it was so nice to get good service.  We ended up eating just about every meal this holiday  weekend and of all the places we visited this was notably superior.  Everyone seemed to like their job and enjoy helping customers.

I went there for lunch with a friend.  It's nice place to get together for business.  Price is reasonable and service was quick and the staff is courteous. The waiter brings you the bill which provides the dollar amount of tips at 15% and so on.  It's very convenient to be able to pay your bill with the computer on your table and eliminates the time for the waiter to go back and forth to the front to run your credit card.  However, the suggested tips include sales tax as the based amount for the tips calculation.   Unless it is an oversight, it artificially inflated the tips one is paying without knowing it.  I hope someone at the corporate office is paying attention to this.

I come here every week on Wednesday with my family, and most days the food is good, the service is prompt and the wait is not too long. Lately though it seems that the wait is longer and longer. The place will be packed, with people waiting for a table, but there is a whole section not being used. I understand the off time when a server calls in sick, but if it is consistent each week, that is a management problem.  Managers (or Corporate) trying to save a buck but cutting back on servers. And if you are going to have a hostess, she should be there ready to greet you when you come in, not bussing tables. Again corners being cut at the expense of service. Too bad.

Watch your check. We are an older couple and like to eat early. Servers work in pairs and ours had 4 patrons including us. Service was slow. Food is just ok as usual. New thing is tech screen on table which allows you to pay your check and not have to wait for server. Well, there are also games on this device which you may play. When our check came we had been charged $.99 for table entertainment. No, we didn't use it and were irritated it was assumed we did. When asked about the charge we were told about the games on the device and asked, "So, you didn't play any games?" Just felt like a clever way to get an extra buck out of clients who do not review their check.

I hadn't been to my neighborhood Chili's in a while since I've been eating more out by my job in DTLA.... once gain, I enjoyed my meal and had great service. Kudos to Chili's for offering some healthy choices. I had the mango tilapia with rice and broccoli. The rice was seasoned well and there was a heaping portion of avocado and mango on the fish. Everything tasted fresh and well seasoned.... I will say the broccoli could have used more butter..... (but then I guess it wouldn't have been on the healthy choice menu)   **I am quite bummed the chicken fajita pita is no longer on the menu :(

Might want to train their hostess in customer service. Went in at 6:45pm I told the hostess there would be 5 and was immediately told they had "no room" for us. When I questioned this she stated that there were no tables available and that people "have a tendency to linger after eating so it could be 45 minutes possibly an hour or more" before a table would be ready.  Real nice. Guess they don't want or need my patronage.
Give me good food and cold beer and I'm happy :) JT is the man at the bar, he takes care of his customers.

3.5 stars but of course there's no choice for that.   The food is always ok, not great just reliable. I do like this location more than others, the staff here is generally nicer than in Montclair where it's really hit or miss. They don't take reservations per se but you can call ahead and get your party on the list.  If you call ahead I highly recommend getting the name of the person you spoke to because on more than one occasion they could not find our name once we arrived.  Also, if they tell you there's no wait and no need to put your name down, insist. We've also followed that advice only to arrive and have a longer than expected wait.   As for food, I always like the enchilada soup especially on a cold day. We actually really like the skillet queso appetizer especially since it also comes with bottomless chips and salsa.  The chips are actually pretty good, very light and crispy.  The 2 for $20 meal options are decent and the molten chocolate lava cake is a favorite dessert to share. I especially like that they can effectively pack that to go if we're too full to eat it there. Very convenient :-)
Happy hour is the shiz, the food is tasty, the drinks are full of alcohol and the servers are dope!

Worst Service Ever!!  We stopped in the La Verne, CA location.  We were seated immediately since there were hardly any patrons in the restaurant at the time.  We ordered water with lemon for drinks.  Our server brought those and then tended his other tables.  After sitting for 10 to 15 minutes, he returned to take our order which was only for the 3 choice appetizer. We sat for another 25 minutes and no food was delivered, so we left.  Won't return. Tried to leave feedback on the Chili's website, but no luck.  The website doesn't accept feedback.  Guess they don't really care about their customers.

They had me at "Bottomless." What can I say, I decided to indulge in salad and soup tastiness.  Their selection of soups were: Potato Cheese, Chicken and Green Chile, Chicken Enchilada, and Sweet Corn. For salads: Classic Caesar or a House Salad with choice of dressing. I'm pretty simple. I had Caesar salad and Chicken Enchilada soup. They were delicious! There was the perfect amount of dressing on the salad and nothing overpowered any of the other items. Bonus, for having fresh romaine lettuce. The soup, well I am a sucker for a girl who brings me a piping hot bowl of soup with the fixings all melting on the top...mmmmm cheddar cheese. It was superb.  I am not sure when Chili's moved to the tag team set up for servers, but I liked it. The guy working was quick to remove any dirty dishes while the chick (Lauren, I think??), was quick to check back on us. Service was awesome overall. Just wish they wore name tags because I am terrible with remembering names.  I decided to have another Caesar and another soup, this time Chicken and Green Chiles. Mistake! The salad was fine, but the soup tasted like the chicken had been over grilled, so there was a strong "char" taste to the whole soup. I could not finish it. I didn't bother finishing or getting another bowl. My friend had the house salads and all 4 soups. He reported to me that he liked the Potato Cheese and the Chicken Enchilada. He asked the server to take back the Chicken and Green Chile and the Sweet Corn. I didn't try the Sweet Corn but I could smell the sweetness of the soup--I think I got a sugar high. Nonetheless, other than the one soup, everything was great. Servers were diligent and friendly. Clean bathrooms and atmosphere. Keep up the great work!

Thought I'd stop in Chili's and get something low carb.  Chose the Chicken Caesar's Salad. $9.00.  Typical Chili's decor except they now have little consoles on the tables to view the drink/ food menus and play games while you wait.  I latex Trivia as I waited about 15 minutes.  When it came, the presentation was bit impressive at all.  A flat plate with salad and a sliced chicken  breast laid on top.  Clearly an untrained "cook".  Had iced tea to drink and the bill with tax tip and $1.00 for the Trivia game came to $16.33.  I thought at least they could have done was to try to trick me with a fancy presentation.  Looked more like the Army's mess.

The manager here is stupid!!! Wanted to buy a $100 gift card to get their promotional 10% off to pay for the bill. The manager said no because it has to be used on a different day (No where does it say this). Just lost out on a bigger sale than what the bill was.

It's a Chili's.  You either like the food, or you kind of like the food, or you despise the food, or you just like the chicken sandwich, or you just like the mushroom jack chicken fajitas, or the buffalo chicken salad . . . or you scoff and sneer at all that it is.   I don't know if I've even eaten at this one.  Food is the same anyhow. What I have experienced in the past few weeks is the bar.  The bar staff is pretty good, amicable, affable. But what is most entertaining is that this bar has a pretty entertaining collection of serious winos and blowhards and characters, with or without a full set of teeth. I suggest you go over there between 4 and 6 o'clock; you'll run into some of the drunkest people you've ever seen at those hours.  Good fun.

This is one of the better chilis restaurants around. Other than the weak sauce happy hour of only $1 off domestic beers, the food is solid and very consistent, and some times the bar tenders will cut you breaks if you sweet talk them and order a bunch of drinks and tip big at the end.. Very nice employees, and a lot of college students work here and also people that never left la verne after high school.... this is the only restaurant in the same parking lot as the theater, so it naturally gets good foot traffic and is always a good local bar scene on thursdays, fridays and saturdays.... Go for the El Nino margarita, it will get you buzzed after one. Also go for the guiltless salmon platter.... very tasty, with good vegetables and black beans to go along with it, and one of the healthier options as well...

Okay, let me just start off by saying that I had the most annoying waiter. There are genuinely upbeat waiters, but this one was the most annoying I've encountered. There is nothing worse than being served by someone who feigns flamboyance. It was very amusing and laughable. Please, if you are a waiter just be your self for goodness' sake. Also, the host was not very attentive and dismissed our request for a window seat by giving us the most unappealing seat instead--near the door.  If you're an average omnivorous eater, then this restaurant is for you. But might I mention that as a vegetarian, there is absolutely nothing on the menu that is veggie-friendly. The salads all have meat. In fact, every dish has some sort of meat. Guess you could just ask without meat...or a soup. My appetizer was salty. My food tasted as though it was pre-cooked, frozen, and then heated up again. God, I could go on about how the food tastes like shit, but I won't go there. Quality is just non-existent in restaurant chains such as Chili's. Skip this, drive a couple of blocks to downtown Claremont and get some real food and quality customer service from people who actually have a personality.

This particular Chili's location is a regular place we go for lunch since we work down the street at the university.   I've visited this location for lunch, happy hour and dinner.  Almost every time I have visited, I have not had to wait very long to be seated at my table, even when we had large groups of 10.   The food at this location is like any other Chili's location.  The menu has a lot of variety and includes salads, appetizers hamburgers, sandwiches, steaks, baby back ribs and chicken.  There is something for everyone on the menu and you'll always leave feeling full because the portions are always big!   I've had many things on the menu, and I have always been happy with my selection.  My favorite item that I order at Chili's is the Chicken Crispers with the Honey Mustard Sauce.  They are greasy when they come to you, but they are great tasting.  And, the honey mustard sauce is the best I have ever had - I wish they sold the the sauce because I would definitely buy a bottle to have at home!   For those of us on diets, they have a great "Guiltless" menu that has low calorie choices.  I've ordered off this menu before and the food tastes great, but be warned you'll get a lot vegetables.  But, they cook the vegetables great and you won't be disappointed! Chili's has great drinks.  So, if you're going during happy hour you'll find some great deals and good drinks.  Margaritas are great and big, and I've always been lucky with bartenders that are generous with the tequila.   Staff at this particular Chili's is always great!  Some of the staff members that we have seen are students at the University and they've always been great to us.  They're fast, friendly and always making sure that we have everything that we need! This Chili's location is great and you should check it out if you're in the area and in the mood for something familiar.

Wow! Really bummed out that the family outing for dinner and a movie had to start out the way it did.....horrible dinner! Food took forever, when we got it most of the items were cold and burnt. My brother in law ordered half a rack of ribs...it had four teenie ribs! Service was horrible, but to too it all off the waiter spilled ranch dressing down my husbands arm and shirt! I know he was humiliated, but walking away saying "sorry about that man" and not even offering him a napkin didn't make me feel sorry for him one bit! We got the bill, nothing was taken off the bill due to the crappy food and nothing even for spilling ranch all over my husband! Unbelievable! Think I will stay clear of this Chili's!
I'm personally not a big fan of Chilis, but once in a while we feel like having a nice mixed drink, try the Strawberry mojito. :)

Skip it. I've always had terrible service here but the worst was last wed when they were doing a fundraiser for a local highschool. It took an hour to get our food and I think it had been sitting.  The service was really bad and no one seemed to care.  When we left it was an hour wait. What a waste for a great cause.
Servers were great but the silverware we were given was all dirty. Thank goodness I ordered finger foods. My roommate had to wait for new place settings.
This is the best Chilis I've been to. The food is pretty good, low prices and awesome drinks. Try the Grand Patron Margarita. BOMB!!

Can't really go wrong here.  It's actually the only major resteraunt name in the area.  Like how they promote the to go since you may not always be able to dine in.  Noticed if you sit in the back by the wall and bathrooms you will here the staff constintly say corner since I guess they can't see around it so probably won't  wanna sit over there.
ribs were so disappointing, wont be going back - the mac and cheese add on was good,
Chilis is Chilis. Just another one here. Booze prices aren't great and the food is what it is.

Love the staff at this Chilis. They keep their cool no matter what and always give you top-notch service. I came here many a time with my lunch crew and we had some pretty difficult people in our group. The waiters were always super-nice and easy to fix any problems with our orders. Also, they would give us free refills to go by bringing out styrofoams cups. I thought that was pretty nice. The food is as great as any other Chili's and of course I recommend the Memphis Dry Baby Back Ribs. Or the Monterey Chicken. Or the Steak Fajitas. Or the Cajun Chicken Pasta, which has the perfect amount of sauce because it's not too dry and the pasta is not swimming in that alfredo sauce. And nothing like the Presidentes for drinks...:)

Okay I work in a restaurant and all of these reviews can most likely be answered with this post my friend wrote.  "To the people who have never worked in a restaurant:  1: if you only see 1 host do not expect that your table for 12 can be put together in a matter of seconds  2: if you see open tables that doesn't mean that there shouldn't be a wait. Usually when there's open tables it's because there isn't a server in that section, the server in that section is taking more tables then they can handle or the kitchen has 40 minute wait times on food. 3: there is always a reason a host will start a wait. We aren't doing it to make you mad, and if you don't want to wait then sit in the bar or leave you really aren't hurting our feelings.  4: don't get butt hurt if a host isn't up there in the 2 seconds you've been waiting, it's probably because they are bussing tables and helping the servers so that when they come back you can be seated instantly.  5: if you complain about the table you're sitting at don't expect to be seated where you want immediately, the hosts do rotation so that everything goes smoothly, they aren't sitting you in that table because they don't like you, they are sitting you there because that's how rotation works, and if rotation gets messed up because you see a table across the restaurant that hasn't been sat but you want it, realize that server probably just got double sat or even triple sat and has 6 other tables they have to attend to so don't get mad when you don't get the service you expect.  6: usually on a Friday, Saturday night restaurants are pretty busy, so always expect a wait and if there isn't one chances are you're lucky.  7: if your server has a full section (usually 6-8 tables at a time), and is taking parties of 6+ it usually means they are attending to 48 people at a time, so if your drinks have been filled in a timely manner but your chips and salsa have still not been filled give them a few minutes you aren't the only people they are trying to make happy.  8: if your food comes out wrong, cold Ect, don't blame your server. Say something and let them know. The servers don't cook the food so when there's something wrong with it it's not the servers fault (unless they accidentally ring in broccoli instead of French fries) or something but usually it's not the servers fault and usually on a busy night, food runners run your food so they have no idea what you ordered they are just bringing the food out to your table to help out their co worker.  9:don't yell at the food runner about your food being wrong, let them know politely if there's something wrong, you can get a lot further with kindness then being rude and angry.  10: it's Christmas time, so everyone is doing their best to save their money, but tipping 10$ on a check of 150 is so insanely rude, if you don't have the money to tip decent then don't go out to eat. The servers aren't working their ass off for you so that you can tip them under 10% they have families and friends that they would like to get Christmas gifts for too.  11: in most cases your server is working their asses off for you, getting refills for tables, appetizers, splitting checks, running food, bussing, clearing plates, and in the back constantly doing side work, running dish, making the strawberry lemonade you love so much, refilling ice Ect, they never have time to use the restroom sit on their phones or sit down and take a break, they are CONSTANTLY doing something and if you are sooo ignorant that you can't see that than please sit yourself at home and eat a TV dinner.  12: I understand that there are pretty terrible servers and things do get messed up but in a lot of cases there are a lot of good ones who work so hard and don't get recognition for it from angry customers and if you're someone who is constantly complaining about things I hope this helps you realize what things are really like, and if you still don't understand please try and work in a restaurant for 2 weeks and let me know what you think "
